positive.review:
Played in the old days when it was released, very enjoyable - saw it had tons of new features, created a new account
register -> success -> validate email -> success -> login -> bad id or pw (weird pw manager is used) ->forgot pw -> fixed -> logged on -> email not validated -> resend -> validate email -> success -> login -> email not validated -> resend -> validate email -> success -> login (rinse and repeat)
weird game. thumbs up for past game experience - cant tell now. uninstalled.

Perfect for those who wanna commit to a game without committing their lives to it. Just a couple of short logins per day and your progress will be legit. 
Those who pay and are consistent will always be ahead of those who don't pay and are consistent. But, those who don't pay and are consistent will always be ahead of those who pay and are not consistent.

Not bad, enjoyed alot before the addition to exploration in the tavern and the restriction on multi account.
Still recommend, good game to fill your time

I‚Äôve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn‚Äôt fully expect. I don‚Äôt want to sound dramatic, but there‚Äôs something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together ‚Äî not in some perfect, polished ‚Äúadvertisement‚Äù way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just‚Ä¶ goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game ‚Äî the visuals, the sound, the pacing ‚Äî kind of blends into this feeling that you‚Äôre actually inside its world, even if you‚Äôre just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit clich√©, but it‚Äôs true. Sometimes it‚Äôs chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you‚Äôre just wandering around thinking ‚Äúok, what now?‚Äù but that‚Äôs honestly part of the charm. The game doesn‚Äôt try to rush you unless it actually needs to.

Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought ‚Äúyeah, I‚Äôve seen this in other games,‚Äù but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It‚Äôs the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn‚Äôt have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again ‚Äî part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don‚Äôt punish you for not following some ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù path.

Overall, I‚Äôd say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn‚Äôt try too hard to impress in the first five minutes ‚Äî instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you‚Äôve been playing way longer than you planned. If you‚Äôre looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that‚Äôs just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would ‚Äî maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.
Dobr√° klikaƒçka na x hodin, ale na houbiƒçky jsem moc chud√Ω....

They say every warrior has two stories:
the one he lives‚Ä¶ and the one he remembers.
Mine began back in primary school, around age 8,
when I barely understood what I was doing ‚Äî just clicking, laughing, exploring.

Years later, at 20-something, I returned with purpose.
This time, I played seriously. I invested. I pushed.
But the game had changed more than I expected.

Time wasn‚Äôt adventure anymore ‚Äî it was currency.
Progress wasn‚Äôt heroic ‚Äî it was limited by hourglasses.
And when the only way to speed up the journey
is through clovers bought with mushrooms bought with money‚Ä¶
the grind stops feeling like a quest, and starts feeling like a countdown.

So today, I say goodbye.

Not to the world ‚Äî but to the race.
Not to the game ‚Äî but to the pressure to ‚Äúkeep up.‚Äù

I‚Äôll forever remember the thrill of clearing a final dungeon,
the roar of my Berserker Molgrath,
the shield of my Paladin Amoras,
and the joy this game gave me through childhood and beyond.

I‚Äôm not leaving because I stopped liking the game.
I‚Äôm leaving because the hourglasses ran out.

And yet‚Ä¶ a hero who leaves
can always return ‚Äî when time allows.

‚ÄúThe adventure doesn‚Äôt end. It just goes idle.‚Äù
so much fun but you have to wait
Why u guys don't make soccer stars again but on steam? i think people would love to play that game again

Nice fun art style,
Simple gameplay but as you play more depth comes out,
Definetely pay to win + need to know exactly what you have to do, if you want to compete in the leaderboard (which is more or less the only thing to aim for, honestly)
However even as a free to play player there are many chances to get premium currency in the game, including daily wheel spin, random reward from quests, events, promo codes from creators on twitch, etc.
You can still play and have fun without spending a dime if you dont care about becoming first in the server, personally I find it quite an enjoyable distraction. Just be patient, you don't need to speed that construction!

Tips for new players:
- Always go for exp quests instead of gold (unless there is a good item reward that you need).
- Join a guild, you are provided with valuable gold and exp passive bonuses.

this games hits everything from the nostalgic stand point every time I leave the game, I end up comming back.
it's also not very time consuming, imo.

weird game. thumbs up for past game experience - cant tell now. uninstalled.

Those who pay and are consistent will always be ahead of those who don't pay and are consistent. But, those who don't pay and are consistent will always be ahead of those who pay and are not consistent.

Still recommend, good game to fill your time
Surprisingly addictive! A simple, humorous RPG that's easy to pick up and play. Progress can be slow, but the daily quests and guild activities keep it engaging. Great for a casual time-waster.

I‚Äôve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn‚Äôt fully expect. I don‚Äôt want to sound dramatic, but there‚Äôs something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together ‚Äî not in some perfect, polished ‚Äúadvertisement‚Äù way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just‚Ä¶ goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game ‚Äî the visuals, the sound, the pacing ‚Äî kind of blends into this feeling that you‚Äôre actually inside its world, even if you‚Äôre just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit clich√©, but it‚Äôs true. Sometimes it‚Äôs chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you‚Äôre just wandering around thinking ‚Äúok, what now?‚Äù but that‚Äôs honestly part of the charm. Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought ‚Äúyeah, I‚Äôve seen this in other games,‚Äù but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It‚Äôs the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn‚Äôt have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again ‚Äî part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don‚Äôt punish you for not following some ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù path.

Overall, I‚Äôd say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn‚Äôt try too hard to impress in the first five minutes ‚Äî instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you‚Äôve been playing way longer than you planned. If you‚Äôre looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that‚Äôs just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would ‚Äî maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.
It's a linear, build yourself up game, so those who spend money will always beat those who don't. It's oddly addictive, however, and a way to use up a few minutes while you're waiting for whatever.

I mean, with all of its quirks, not a badgame after all. Maybe i put a few more hours in, just in case...

negative.review: Played the game years ago when it was browser only, had good memories. Now its one of the biggest p2w games out there. You can play on an old server and never catch up. Or you can play on a new server and even $1k wont let you keep up with most players. No new players join the game anymore, its just nostalgia chasing 30+ people swiping their rent to skip ads and idle time. Not even a game anymore.

Played for about 2 weeks and was a decent time killer.  Created an account to save progress and everything was fine until today...  Opened the app only to find that my char is completely gone and it says I do not have an account.  Ummm, no?  That was the very first thing I did before starting the game.  Now everything is gone.  So screw it.  If a company is this bad where they delete accts and characters within 2 weeks, they don't deserve money or a positive rating.  Don't even attempt to tell me to email customer service.  Not worth it.  Quite honestly, the microtransactions were ridiculously high anyways.  Good luck, if you decide to play this game.
Boring mobile game

Played the game years ago when it was browser only, had good memories. Now its one of the biggest p2w games out there. You can play on an old server and never catch up. Or you can play on a new server and even $1k wont let you keep up with most players. No new players join the game anymore, its just nostalgia chasing 30+ people swiping their rent to skip ads and idle time. Not even a game anymore.

First of all, before playing this game I recommend to watch Chris WIlson's Dark Patterns video (creator of path of exile).
S&F is a Fun game, with cool content hidden behind the HUGE PAYWALL of shrooms - ingame curency.
Devs call this game completely free to play. It's a bait and a lie! Pay to Win players have infinite times faster progression. Shakes and Fidget content creators will harshly defend this game and say "well you can bla bla free to play" Bullsh!t
Only worth your time if you, as a content creator, have an endless supply of mushrooms.
Art part of the game - the music and the visuals are pretty cool! Enjoyable! Creative!
#paytowin #paywall #shakesandfidget

Played for about 2 weeks and was a decent time killer.  Created an account to save progress and everything was fine until today...  Opened the app only to find that my char is completely gone and it says I do not have an account.  Ummm, no?  That was the very first thing I did before starting the game.  Now everything is gone.  So screw it.  If a company is this bad where they delete accts and characters within 2 weeks, they don't deserve money or a positive rating.  Don't even attempt to tell me to email customer service.  Not worth it.  Quite honestly, the microtransactions were ridiculously high anyways.  Good luck, if you decide to play this game.
It's not a game, especially a fun game, when you are forced to wait after every quest.  If I wanted to be that bored, I would take up reading books.
tato hra je nahovno lebo ma spamuju porpadsky cigani ze mam dat arenu!!!!!!!!
Feels weird to give this a negative review as it seems to have alot of care, it just feels like a trimmed down NeoPets mechcanically
Can't login when I play on the steam version since the latest update
Steam cloud save breaks constantly
Seems cool but its not for me
Boring mobile game
Easy to get bored, very few new things

Opened the app only to find that my char is completely gone and it says I do not have an account.  Ummm, no?  That was the very first thing I did before starting the game.  Now everything is gone.  So screw it.  If a company is this bad where they delete accts and characters within 2 weeks, they don't deserve money or a positive rating.  Don't even attempt to tell me to email customer service.  Not worth it.  Quite honestly, the microtransactions were ridiculously high anyways.  Good luck, if you decide to play this game.
It's not a game, especially a fun game, when you are forced to wait after every quest.  If I wanted to be that bored, I would take up reading books.
tato hra je nahovno lebo ma spamuju porpadsky cigani ze mam dat arenu!!!!!!!!
Feels weird to give this a negative review as it seems to have alot of care, it just feels like a trimmed down NeoPets mechcanically
Can't login when I play on the steam version since the latest update
Steam cloud save breaks constantly
Seems cool but its not for me
Boring mobile game
Easy to get bored, very few new things

Played the game years ago when it was browser only, had good memories. Now its one of the biggest p2w games out there. You can play on an old server and never catch up. Or you can play on a new server and even $1k wont let you keep up with most players. No new players join the game anymore, its just nostalgia chasing 30+ people swiping their rent to skip ads and idle time. Not even a game anymore.

First of all, before playing this game I recommend to watch Chris WIlson's Dark Patterns video (creator of path of exile).
S&F is a Fun game, with cool content hidden behind the HUGE PAYWALL of shrooms - ingame curency.
Devs call this game completely free to play. It's a bait and a lie! Pay to Win players have infinite times faster progression. Shakes and Fidget content creators will harshly defend this game and say "well you can bla bla free to play" Bullsh!t
Only worth your time if you, as a content creator, have an endless supply of mushrooms.
Art part of the game - the music and the visuals are pretty cool! Enjoyable! Creative!
